messages.subject: Re: lead in crayons
messages.msgSnippet: That could explain my poor long term memory! Mary Ellen Neglect Not The Gift That Is In Thee ... coloring your lips with the crayon, you probably did get a
messages.messageBody:
That could explain my poor long term memory!
Mary Ellen
Neglect Not The Gift That Is In Thee


>>>Unfortunately, if you were
coloring your lips with the crayon, you probably did get a good dose of
lead
in you at that time :o(

Here's to artistry and creativity... but it can be crushed by the damage
lead
causes to the brain, not just ranting educators who insist you color in
the
lines and be like everyone else :o)

Kim in Ohio
Childhood lead poisoning prevention advocate, community organizer -
program
development coordinator for the Association of Parents to Prevent Lead
Exposure (APPLE)
Mom to two great guys
